Not many people are aware of this, but there has been an ongoing dispute centering on the remains of Christopher Columbus. Both Spain and The Dominican Republic claim to both possess the true remains. Imagine the tourist revenue that would be forfeited if the remains of either country to be proven fake. Both countries apparently did, reportedly denying scientists the opportunity to perform genetic experimentation to confirm the validity of their respective remains. Well, in a exciting turn of events, Spain has finally agreed to allow scientists the opportunity to exhume what "remains" of Columbus from his tomb in order to confirm their authenticity. The Dominican Republic, however, remains cagey, again denying (by simply not responding!) the scientists from laying a white gloved finger on their tomb!
